content.text:
# List of battles with most French military fatalities

This article contains a list of battles with most French military fatalities, in terms of French deaths.
Introduction
This article lists battles and campaigns in which the number of French military fatalities exceed 1,000. The term casualty in warfare refers to a soldier who is no longer fit to fight after he or she has been in combat. Casualties can include killed, wounded, missing, captured or deserted. In this article, the numbers killed refer to those killed in action, killed by disease, missing presumed dead, or someone who died from their wounds.
